newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Sao Paulo industrial firms sack 7,407 in November.
newsitem.headline: Sao Paulo industrial firms sack 7,407 in November.

text.p: Private industrial firms located in Sao Paulo state laid off 7,407 employees in November, compared with 9,462 firings in October, a spokeswoman for the Sao Paulo State Industries Federation (Fiesp) said.
Twenty-one out of the 46 sectors included in the survey sacked personnel in the period. Fifteen hired new people and ten maintained their staff unchanged, she said.
So far this year, Sao Paulo industries have laid off 167,556 workers or 7.85 percent of the Sao Paulo's industrial workforce, the spokeswoman said.
In the last 12 months, Sao Paulo firms have sacked 194,614 workers, or 8.91 percent of Sao Paulo's industrial workforce, she added.
